<< false logical type functions true >>

logical

Converts a numeric value to logical type.

Syntax

Y = logical(X)

Input argument

X

a numeric value.

Output argument

Y

a logical value.

Description

logical converts a numeric value to logical type.

Nonzero value converted to true and zeros values converted to false.

Complex numbers returns an error.

Example

A = eye(2, 2)
B = logical(A)
islogical(B)

See also

islogical.

History

Version Description
1.0.0 initial version

Author

Allan CORNET
